title: All that is Solid Melts into Air: The Experience of Modernity

An accessible and often fascinating introduction to the literature and politics of nineteenth- and twentiethcentury modernity that sets the scene for many contemporary debates about the modern and the postmodern

note: A detailed and wide-ranging introduction to postmodern culture, theory and sociology.
title: The Idea of the Postmodern: A History
Postmodernist Culture: An Introduction to Theories of the Contemporary

A very detailed introduction to the culture of postmodernism which provides indepth discussions of topics ranging from legal theory to popular television, and produces a coherent account of the contemporary arts
The Condition of Postmodernity, Oxford: Blackwell. [An influential and always accessible sociological analysis of the economic and political implications of postmodern theory and culture
Postmodernity
A very accessible and interesting introduction to the politics and sociology of postmodernity

Also extremely useful are the introductions to individual theorists included in the Routledge Critical Thinkers series. Each of these offers a straightforward introduction to the theorist’s work and an exploration of their impact on modern thought and culture. Particularly relevant for readers interested in the postmodern are: Lane
Jean Baudrillard
More than a Game: The Computer Game as Fictional Form
In the Shadow of the Silent Majorities: Or, the End of the Social and Other Essays
The Gulf War Did Not Take Place
The Consumer Society: Myths and Structures
Life in Fragments: Essays in Postmodern Morality
The Global Transformations Reader: an Introduction to the Globalisation Debate
The Feminist Reader: Essays in Gender and the Politics of Literary Criticism
All that is Solid Melts into Air: The Experience of Modernity
The Idea of the Postmodern: A History
The Postmodern Adventure: Science, Technology and Cultural Studies at the Third Millennium
Aesthetics and Subjectivity from Kant to Nietzsche
